content: The creator of the fastest-growing open source project in GitHub history, Peter Steinberger (OpenClaw), joined OpenAI, a move that is more complicated than a simple acqui-hire, especially given that both Mark Zuckerberg (Meta) and Sam Altman (OpenAI) personally competed for him.
Peter Steinberger's move to OpenAI signals the direction the entire industry is headed in 2026.
OpenClaw achieved 200,000 GitHub stars, emerging from project number 44 after a nine-figure exit.
The Chrome-Chromium model influences the future of the open source community.
The operational knowledge of OpenClaw is revealed by the shipment of over 40 security patches days before the announcement of Peter Steinberger joining OpenAI.
The industry is shifting from chatbots to personal agents that manage real computers.
For developers and builders, the question is no longer whether delegation becomes the new interface paradigm, but rather who owns the foundational layer underneath it.
